definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.chinese: 沒有遺傳工程，什麼也沒有。

sentences.english: The first involves incorporating active phytase into conventional feed rations, while the second uses genetic engineering to introduce the phytase into crops.
sentences.chinese: 第二項技術是採用遺傳工程將植酸酶基因轉入穀物中。

sentences.english: Martha studies genetic engineering at Columbia.
sentences.chinese: 馬莎在哥倫比亞學習遺傳工程。

sentences.english: Americans are still split in their opinions about genetically engineer foods.
sentences.chinese: 對於基因遺傳工程食品，美國民衆依然持有意見分歧。

sentences.english: Contruct genetic linkage map, clone and transfer toxalbumin gene are the main two aspects of application of genetic engineering in forestry.
sentences.chinese: 植物遺傳工程研究在林業研究中的應用有兩個方面。

sentences.english: I graduated from the Biology Department of Wuhan University in 2006, majoring in genetic engineering .
sentences.chinese: 我於2006年畢業於武漢大學生物系遺傳工程專業。

sentences.english: Xiao Ming has been admitted by Shanghai University to study genetic engineering.
sentences.chinese: 小明考入了上海大學的遺傳工程專業。

sentences.english: At the moment, what passes for genetic engineering is mere pottering.
sentences.chinese: 到那個時候，遺傳工程就只是一個手工活而已。
